Perhaps that's why the game, which was due to arrive on Steam tomorrow, has been delayed until an unspecified date. That's okay, half the news stories we write seem to be about release setbacks. At least the developers announced the delay in a funny and thematically appropriate way.
Read more
articles.title: Bicycle delivery sim Parcel Corps is delayed but at least it's funny about it

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Risk of Rain 2: Seekers of the Storm released last Tuesday, and hasn’t gone down too well with fans of the co-op roguelite. How not well, you ask? To shreds, I say - it’s currently sitting at 79% ‘mostly negative’ rating on Steam. Among the chief complaints are…uh, everything, it looks like. The DLC is reportedly so bug-ridden that it’s taken many of the base game’s core systems down with it.
Gearbox - who acquired Risk Of Rain from Hopoo Games in 2022 - have since put out a blog with a list of known issues they’re targeting, and encourage players to keep submitting bug reports. Among the listed issues are a boss named Mithrix becoming invincible (“definitely not intentional”), and “an issue that allowed players to get stuck while smelling the flowers”.
Read more
articles.title: Risk Of Rain 2 creators “still believe that Gearbox is heading in the right direction” despite troubles with recent DLC

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Strange omens abound as late. Chickens are born with four wings, like horrible feathered dragonflies. Cows scream at the sky, then produce bile instead of milk. Most chilling of all, Aldi have discontinued their Village Bakery Seeded Medium Sliced Loaf (400g), replacing it with deeply inferior Village Bakery Lightly Seeded Loaf (800g). Throughout the chaos, the Maw simply grins, although it does seem to have a few more seeds betwixt its teeth than last week. Perhaps the Maw will deign to spit a single seed at us, from which we can grow the sapling of a new world and finally abandon this cursed, Medium Loafless existence. Until then, here are this week’s PC game releases of note.
Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! I’ve moved on to Wolfe’s Sword Of The Lictor this week and, readers, I’m starting to think that Severian might not be a very good dude. This week it’s Still Wakes the Deep, Little Orpheus, and Robocraft designer (along with many others) and current lead technical level designer at Half Mermaid, Robert McLachlan! Cheers Robert! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Still Wakes the Deep, Little Orpheus and Robocraft's Robert McLachlan

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for more cat. She’s reached the “follow me into the bathroom when I go downstairs at night for a wee” stage, but still won’t come upstairs - which means I have to leave her alone for long periods while I work, which makes me feel bad. Before I unsuccessfully arrange yet more treats on the stairs, let’s read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Another week, another Steam Fest looms. From September 2st until the 9rd you'll be able to find intergalactic discounts and demos in the Steam Space Exploration Fest.

 
Read more
articles.title: Steam's Space Exploration Fest kicks off deals and demos on September 2nd

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Against The Storm already contains a zoo's-worth of animal-people to order around as you attempt to build a town that can survive the perma-rain of the Blightstorm. That doesn't stop new expansion Keepers Of The Stone from adding one more. Come September 26th, you'll be able to welcome the frog people as you venture into a new biome.

 
Read more
articles.title: Against The Storm is getting frogs and a new biome in its first expansion this September

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Todd Howard recently said that he wanted people to experience Fallout 1 and 2 as they were, rather than remake them. Well, this'll make things easier: both games are currently free to keep as part of the Fallout Classic Collection over on the Epic Games Store.

Fallout Tactics is free, too, but I don't know whether Todd's cruel enough to want people to experience that one as it was.

 
Read more
articles.title: Fallout 1 and 2 (and Tactics) are currently free-to-keep from the Epic Games Store

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
Time to set the record straight! I wasn't too busy playing Black Myth: Wukong to write up last weekend's Playing This Weekend. I'd never fail you all thus! Instead, I had one of the worst flu illnesses I've ever had, followed by a nice bout of tonsillitis, for which I'm still on antibiotics. Thankfully, I can now look at a monitor screen for more than an hour before feeling sick, so gaming is no longer out of the question for this weekend. Let's see what we're all going to be clicking on!
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I took a longer lunch break today, and must now Pay The Reaper by staying after work. Fortunately, I've spent my penance playing the demo for Witching Stone, which applies the magic of shape-matching to the magic of, well, magic. Out on 16th September, it's a pixelart charmer that "combines elements of puzzle games, roguelites and deckbuilders", much as you'd combine a red circle and two golden triangles to spark a lightning bolt.
 Read more
articles.title: Witching Stone has you joining up shapes into spells and is massively charming - here's a demo

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
In the first post for my series on "saving" open world design, I complained that many of today's open worlds feel like checklists of formulaic tasks and rewards, their geography a vaporous staging ground for itemisable, cycling content-gathering opportunities, which flies in the face of the sense of freedom and wonder they're supposed to inspire. My interviewees, Elder Scrolls veterans Matt Firor and Nate Purkeypile, argued that this reflects the expense and scale of today's open world productions, which constrains experimental design both at a practical level and in terms of overall direction.
CD Projekt open world designer Jakub Tomczak doesn't, as far as I know, have an answer to the issue of production bloat, but he does have a disarmingly obvious solution to the 'checklist problem', based on his time creating missions for Cyberpunk 2077 and its Phantom Liberty expansion: get better at hiding the checklist. Weave it into the landscape and setting more artfully, with an elegant balance of randomisation and responsiveness to the player's behaviour which keeps everything fresh. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Show less, randomise more: a Cyberpunk 2077 designer on how to stop open worlds feeling exhausting

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
It is with quiet anticipation (and some nervousness) that I await to be stepped upon by a freaky mech in The Forever Winter. If you missed its announcement in May, The Forever Winter is a co-op extraction shooter set in a grim future where you struggle to survive amid an unending hyperindustrial war. Since that reveal developers Fun Dog Studios have mostly been sending out small "burst transmissions" - essentially footage from the hellfront - like this patriotic beheading and some panicked gunfights. But today they've made a longer video revealing an early access release date. And - oh! - it's quite soon.
Read more
articles.title: The mommy mechs of The Forever Winter are stomping into early access next month

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I won an awful board game from Nickelodeon once. I say “won”. Actually, I got disconnected phoning into a competition line after I’d gotten through, got upset loudly, my mum called them to complain, they fast tracked me to the next competition thing, I got the quiz answer wrong, and the presenter pretended he’d heard the right answer and pulled a prize out of the big prize bucket. It was a copy of The Game of Life, possibly the least exciting board game a child can win.
The game was dog water, and there’s probably a lesson in there somewhere about how cool and good it is to whine until you get free things, but we don’t have time for that. Instead, I’d like to draw your attention to Floops Big House Adventure. It’s a grungy, slimy, Aaahh!!! Real Monsters meets Ren and Stimpy Saturday morning shooter. Some of you will already hate it from the header screenshot, I imagine. Personally, the art drew me right in.
Read more
articles.title: Floops Big House Adventure is a Nickelodeon Saturday morning gross-out shooter

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Here’s one we missed from this week’s release round-up, possibly because Konami appear to have given it precisely zero promotion: the Castlevania Dominus Collection, a four-game bundle spanning PC ports of three well-regarded DS Castlevanias, plus a redesigned version of Castlevania Haunted Castle, the first Castlevania game to grace an arcade machine. It’ll set you back $25, £20 or €25, and my drive-by analysis of the trailer below is that they've done a decent job with the ports.
 Read more
articles.title: Konami's Castlevania Dominus Collection bundles up three DS hits and one arcade remaster for £20 or $25

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Darkest Dungeon 2's Kingdoms mode - a free turn-based boardgame reimagining of the hellish roguelike roadtrip RPG - will release in three modules, Red Hook have announced. The first of this fearful trio, Hunger Of The Beast Clan, is down to launch in Q4 2024, which translates to sometime during the period 1st October to 31st December.
It'll accompany a new paid Darkest Dungeon 2 DLC, Inhuman Bondage, which introduces a new region, a new hero with "...unique" mechanics and a fresh faction of seemingly excrement-themed fiends to slaughter.
 
Read more
articles.title: Darkest Dungeon 2's free strategy game Kingdoms update is coming in three parts, with the first due in 2024

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Remedy were “thrilled as Finnish people can be” to announce yesterday that they’ve secured funding for a Control sequel in a co-financing deal with Annapurna, who are also helping the Alan Wake studio bring their connected universe to “film, TV, and beyond”.
While I’m pretty jazzed to see what the coffee-addled minds that brought us Threshold Kids can conjure up under that tantalising ‘beyond’ label, I’ll skip the speculation from now. Here’s the skinny from Remedy’s communications director Thomas Puha:
Read more
articles.title: Remedy partner with Annapurna to co-finance Control 2 and explore Control and Alan Wake TV and film adaptations

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The first time I encountered Jack King-Spooner's work, it was when he sent me a copy of Sluggish Morss: Pattern Circus over hospital wifi late at night. The game was a bright spot in a bad time, which might seem peculiar given that Sluggish Morss often looks like a whale's upset stomach, but it's such a feverishly inventive creation. It blew the dust from my synapses.
The same appears true of King-Spooner's upcoming Judero, on which he is collaborating with Soul Searching developer Talha Kaya. It casts you as a "pagan seer" armed with a big stick, who is searching the mythical Scottish borderlands for evil creatures to clobber. It looks cheerier and airier than Sluggish Morss, with a more overt emphasis on mechanics such as combat, but it has the same pickled 3am energy to it. It's also now got a release date - 16th September - and a new trailer below.
 
Read more
articles.title: Rejoice fellow pagans, for stop-motion Scottish Border brawler Judero will launch in September

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The situation: Sumo Newcastle are making a dystopian on-foot multiplayer racing game called Deathsprint 66, in which you control one of eight Running Men hurtling through the spiked and bladed contours of a futuristic megacity. The complication: competing against other actual human beings isn't always pleasant or desirable, especially when hurtling through the spiked and bladed contours of a futuristic megacity. The solution: Deathsprint 66 is getting a set of PvE-focussed "Episodes" in which just one human player plus optional bots hurtle through the spiked and bladed contours of a futuristic megacity.
 Read more
articles.title: Bloody on-foot racer Deathsprint 66 is getting singleplayer PvE modes with grisly challenges

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Baldur's Gate 3 publishing director Michael Douse has reopened the topic of video game prices being very modest for what those games offer, commenting that the pricing of blockbusters like the recent Star Wars Outlaws has not kept pace with rising development costs and general economic inflation.
 Read more
articles.title: Baldur's Gate 3 publishing director says "almost all games should cost more at a base level" because they cost so much to make

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I would not be at all surprised to learn that the voice actors in stealthy Mimimi-style cone’em up Sumerian Six are Americans doing impressions of British accents. The opening radio chat between starting squad member Sid and a pal has that telltale charming tinge of overeager cockney. It also contains the words “bloody” and “arse” in quick succession, though thankfully not next to each other. The only piles are the logs Sid’s crouched behind as he prepares to sneak up to a cable car guarded by Nazis. That is the only haemorrhoids allusion I will ever make on this website. Until the next time I have to write about Andrew Wilson.
“Oil just use my trusty knoife” mutters Sid as I take down my first guard. Straight away, the animation and noise indicators evoke the same Shadow Tactics or Desperados III goodness you’re probably expecting. Fine with me - that’s exactly what I’m here for. Mimimi’s closing was a real gutpunch, and while I don’t expect anyone to match their exceptional work any time soon, it’s at least reassuring to see Warsaw studio Artificer picking up the torch.
Read more
articles.title: Sumerian Six is Shadow Tactics but you're hitting Nazis in the back of the skull with a hammer

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Unionised workers at Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 studio Raven Software have filed a complaint with the US National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) against parent companies Activision Blizzard and Microsoft, as reported by Game File (paywalled), and covered by Game Developer. The complaint, write Game Developer, is over “bad faith bargaining” and “concerted activities” - which covers "retaliation, discharge, [and] discipline."
Read more
articles.title: Call Of Duty Black Ops 6 developer union have accused Activision Blizzard and Microsoft of “bad faith bargaining”

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Step this way please, fans of pre-rendered backgrounds and pixellated blood spatters. There is something waiting for you in the window of the local internet video game store, GOG.com. Resident Evil 2, the original 1998 survival horror, is now buyable, downloadable, and yes, even playable on PC. 
Read more
articles.title: The original Resident Evil 2 from 1998 comes shambling and groaning back to PC

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Back in March, Bungie announced a leadership reshuffle on their Marathon reboot project, with former Valorant dev Joe Ziegler replacing veteran Bungie designer Christopher Barrett as director. It seems there was more to that story than concern about the progress of Marathon. According to a new Bloomberg report citing anonymous sources, Barrett was in fact fired this spring after he was accused by several female Bungie staff of inappropriate behaviour.
  
Read more
articles.title: Bungie reportedly fired Marathon reboot director Chris Barrett for "unwanted" and "inappropriate" messages to female staff

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Every now and then I reflect on the statistically determined average age of a Gamer – what is it now, 36, 37? Please let it still be under 40 – and realise with alarm that, by extrapolation, a lot of the people reading this probably have children. Augh, children! Please excuse me while I go stand on a chair, clutching a broom. I’ve never understood the craze for generating smaller versions of yourself. It’s one of those weirder subcultures you read about in the papers, but rarely observe in daily life. 


I do, however, understand the appeal of same-screen co-op games like Run From Mummies - which, being a bloodless comedy dungeon romp, seems like a fair pick for those encumbered with boisterous selfspawn. Don’t worry, the “mummies” of the title are just regular old disembowelled corpses wrapped in cloth, not those sinister, non-embalmed “mothers” you’ve been hearing about down the grocers.

 
Read more
articles.title: Run From Mummies will probably tickle Power Stone players as much as it does pyramid-robbing children

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Sometimes you forget to build a graveyard. It happens. When ten citizens dropped dead on the roads of one of my settlements in post-apocalyptic city builder Endzone 2, I had to work fast to avoid a sickness breaking out. But graveyards require a lot of space, and if you've already filled your shanty town with a sea of corrugated metal roofs, this poses a problem. Welcome to the pleasant headache of town planning in a post-nuclear world, where most of the land is brown and uninhabitable. 
Read more
articles.title: Endzone 2 early access review: rebuild humanity as a post-apocalyptic plate-spinner

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I do like a combat system that resembles an overflowing dressmaker's draw, full of bouncing rubber thimbles and coils of bunting. While it's not quite as chaotic and entangled as say, Disgaea, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is one of those games. I'd call it "baroque", but that would be out of synch with developer Sandfall Interactive's stated influences: the new RPG takes place in a molten and fragmented fantasy world based on the Belle Époque or "beautiful era" of late 19th century France. Your job as player is to stop a sorcerous Paintress from painting everybody over a certain age out of existence. We'll circle back to the plot, though. First, the excessively ornate battlin'.
 
Read more
articles.title: Noughties-style JRPG Clair Obscur wants to recapture the glories of Lost Odyssey, with a touch of Devil May Cry

articles.author: Rick Lane
articles.description:
Stormgate is a confusing proposition. It's an RTS directed by former Blizzard developers that is almost, but not quite, entirely unlike StarCraft. It's a free-to-play game, but has a business model that makes you feel like you're getting a rougher deal than if you just dropped thirty notes for it outright. It's available now in Early Access, but has already been available in a kind of gravity-defying Super Early Access for several weeks (which you had to pay to get into).


All of which has made me feel very tired, and yearn for the days when you went into a shop and bought a game in a box for a set amount of money, and the whole game was in the box and you went home and put it on your PC and played it until your mum said "Richard!" (only my mum calls me Richard) "get off that computer and go outside and get some exercise! Do you want to be dead at 35?" Well, I'm 36 now mum. Nearly 37. So who's laughing through their heart palpitations now?

 
Read more
articles.title: Stormgate early access review: this StarCraft wannabe brims with potential, but makes a poor first impression

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Update:  This evening, we received the following "communication from the Spiders studio":

Paris, 28th August 2024 – The Union of Video Game Workers (Syndicat des
Travailleurs (ses) du Jeu Vidéo) has publicly relayed allegations concerning the
working environment at Spiders. The false and even defamatory accusations made by
the STJV in no way reflect the reality of the day-to-day working life of the company's
employees and are an attack on the reputation of the studio, whose teams are fully
mobilized to produce quality games and enthusiastically ensure the Early Access
release of GreedFall 2.

Spiders' management is committed to open and constructive social dialogue. After
unsuccessful attempts over the last few days to meet with a delegation of employees,
they have proposed a meeting again by the end of the week.

Spiders' employees are the heart of the studio, and we are determined to maintain an
inclusive and stimulating working environment in which every talent can flourish and of
which we can all be proud.

The email was signed by Consulting Director Caroline Richard and Associate Director Laurence Tovi.
Original article continues below:
Read more
articles.title: Greedfall 2 developers call a strike over working conditions, lack of gender equality and parity, and “global mismanagement”

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
There’s nowt more magical than the lambent inscriptions of tangled sigils required to spell places like Ainderby Quernhow, Weedley Copse, or Upper Poppleton. A shiny whippet to the first of you to correctly identify which of these are real, and which were invented for “roguelite word puzzle RPG” Sternly Worded Adventures. Actually, scratch that. I’m not made of whippets, and you can just as easily find out yourself via the Steam demo. I think you should, if only because “I killed a slime by spelling out the word Toblerone” is easily in my top ten gaming moments of the year.
Read more
articles.title: “Spell words with over 25 different letters” as you travel through “Yorkshire-sounding” places in puzzle RPG Sternly Worded Adventures

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Exterminatus. Exterminatus. You’re all exterminatused. None of you are free of sin. Except, maybe Focus Interactive are actually? While it would be a monumentally silly heel turn to go back on their promise of only charging Space Marine 2 players extra for cosmetics a mere week and change before the shooter’s September 9 release date,  the new year one roadmap does at least look piously forthright.
Chatting to James at Gamescom recently (possibly from his cathedral ship made out of graphics cards), Saber boss Tim Willits dragged out an armoured horse and proceeded to flog it mercilessly, saying that players don’t want to be sold the equivalent of Oblivion's infamous deadbeat daddy of DLCs. As several of you identified, this seemed like an odd comparison when Spice Maureen 2 specifically plans to charge for comparable cosmetics, although I imagine Willits was referencing the “packs” that his space game’s baubles come in. “Our fans never thought we ripped them off in World War Z,” he said, comparing Space Marine 2’s optional spendables to that game.
Whether you see the cosmetic's pricing as egregious or not, yesterday’s roadmap does look to make good on Saber’s promise to keep wearables and playables separate. Here’s it:
Read more
articles.title: Fair play to Saber - Space Marine 2’s roadmap has all the juicy bits for free, although sprucing up your blueberry mates will cost you

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Nintendo Direct brings us a gift, and one in the form of exciting news about history's most squirrel stuffed RPGs. Can you really claim 108 characters when five of them are flying squirrels with different colour capes? Never mind all that. Suikoden 1 & 2 HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars has a new release date: March 6, 2025.
I’ll get into details in a minute, but since it came up in Slack chat earlier, I’d first like to share with you the differences between the 1995 JRPG’s EU PS1 one cover art:
 
Read more
articles.title: Suikoden 1 and 2 HD Remaster are maybe hopefully possibly finally coming out next March

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I find it bizarre that people still really like Crash Bandicoot games in this, the year 2024, two decades after the decline of the platform mascot warz. I have ample nostalgia for the old marsupial myself, with his second Naughty Dog-developed outing being a particular obsession, but come now, we're all about deckbuilders, soulsliking and battle royale nowadays, right?
Still, I'll admit to a twinge of disappointment after reading that a Crash Bandicoot 5 was once in development at Crash 4: It's About Time developers Toys For Bob, and might have featured an interdimensional team-up with one of Crash's old rivals. No, not Mario.

 
Read more
articles.title: Activision cancelled Crash Bandicoot 5 to make room for more online live service games, claims report

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The dwarven engineers of The Lord Of The Rings: Return To Moria have formally entered the Golden Age of Steam. The game is now available on Valve's digital storefront, after a year in the comparatively barren underdark of the Epic Games Store, and developers Free Range Games have also released a Golden Update, which adds offline single player pausing, around 100 building objects, and a sandbox mode allowing for non-story-led excavation and settlement of the game's procedurally generated mountains. Plus, new hats and axes! Try not to get dragon sickness.
 
Read more
articles.title: Secret best Tolkien game Return To Moria gets Steam release with Steam Deck support and new sandbox mode

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
When we talk about a game having a sense of place, it’s often about how adroitly it covers up the necessary falsehoods of a world contrived to accommodate the player character. It’s the good kind of lie. One with purpose, like Lucas smearing vaseline over the camera lens to cover up the landspeeder’s wheels. Star Wars Outlaws, then, is a strange case. Because while its planets and cities do feel ersatz as living places, they’re kind of incredible as film sets. That’s your job here. This is where the game is. You don’t play it so much as you perform your role in a series of loving, enthusiastic callbacks. That’s a star war. This is a star war. Oh, hey, I know that! That’s one of my favourite star warses.
Read more
articles.title: Star Wars Outlaws review: a perfectly ok bit of star war

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The slugcat of Rain World is a distinct little character. He flops around, squeezing through narrow tunnels with a movement that's both cute and mildly gross. When he is eaten by a passing disco lizard or ravenous skull-faced vulture, it is because he is basically a delicious Squirmle existing in a horrifying cryptozoological ecosystem. He is, however, never stepped upon by a mech with a missile launcher. He is never given a shotgun and tasked with shooting the other animals. Yet that basically seems to be the elevator pitch for Uruc, a sci-fi metroidvania set in a distant future where strange life battles mechanical monstrosities. 
Read more
articles.title: Metroidvania Uruc is like Rain World but the slugcat gets a shotgun and pilots a mech

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
It's been a while since I last played World Of Warcraft, but that doesn't stop me from listening to the Elwynn Forest theme whenever I need to decompress. And as I understand it, WoW's latest expansion The War Within adds to a game that's largely unrecognisable from those vanilla days. That's not necessarily a bad thing, and with TWW out this very second it does make me think, "Hmmm, what if I do make a return". This happens every time. I'd quite like to see the new continent, the new class features, and the expanded Skyriding.
Read more
articles.title: World Of Warcraft's latest expansion The War Within is live, adding a new continent, hero talents and Delves

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
This morning I left my torpid flat in search of coffee, sniffed the restive wind, noted with approval the gloom gathering beneath the trees, and thought: at last, summer is over. At last, we quit the disgusting sunlit months. At last we leave all that is green and good behind, and return to the time of monsters.
Supermassive Games and Behaviour Interactive must have gotten the memo too. They've just released a demo for their next horror game The Casting Of Frank Stone, in which you are a policeman, Sam Green, who is investigating the disappearance of a child. The search leads you to Cedar Hills Steel Mill, "where chilling secrets await, revealing a far more sinister truth than anyone could have anticipated". I am anticipating: QTEs during escape sequences, branching choices that get people killed, and General Mature Content appropriate to the coming of Halloween.
 Read more
articles.title: Here's a demo for Dead By Daylight spin-off The Casting Of Frank Stone, from the makers of Until Dawn

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you live in the UK, you may have noticed that this week is shy a working day. Credulous fools attribute this to the existence of a "bank holiday" on Monday 26th, but true initiates like ourselves know the sobering truth: the Maw has eaten one of our weekdays. We have dispatched our finest gastronauts equipped with extremely long pairs of tweezers to retrieve the missing Monday from the Maw's bowels. We can only hope it hasn't been digested yet - imagine living in a world with a four-day working week? The horror. Anyway, here are this week's PC game releases of note.
Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Almost a decade after his acrimonious departure from Konami, the shadow of Hideo Kojima still looms over Metal Gear Solid. He's there, barely camouflaged, in the undergrowth of Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater - a remake of the fifth Metal Gear game, originally released in 2004, which tells the tale of a lone US special operator hunting superweapons and old mentors in the jungles of the southern Soviet Union. 


I say "remake" but this feels more like a re-release, in spirit. True, it now runs on Unreal Engine, with the option of a manual, third-person perspective and cover-shooter controls in addition to the old top-down viewpoints. Yes, it boasts new flourishes, such as wounds now leaving scars, and clothes picking up stray leaves. Yes, there's a new interface with floating in-world menus, which makes shuffling between the layers a bit less awkward. It's the product of much labour, with development split between Konami and external support partner Virtuos. But where Konami's other big restoration project, Bloober's Silent Hill 2 remake, is a creative dialogue with the original game, Delta seems consumed by faithfulness to Kojima's original design.

 
Read more
articles.title: Does Metal Gear Solid need a new Kojima? Konami have “many people” in mind, but it's "difficult"

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! As is customary, I must jam my new cat into every article. I’ve tried to offer her several books, but she’s failed to turn even a single page so far. What a big dumbo. The best dumbo. The sweetest, smartest dumbo in the world, yes she is. Ahem. This week, it’s Supermassive, Niantic, and Sensible Object narrative designer and Limit Break mentor, Anastasia Dukakis! Cheers Ana! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Supermassive and Niantic narrative designer Anastasia Dukakis

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for more cat. She’s flop and headbutt-level comfortable around me now, but she still seems a bit terrified of my house in general. I’m going to hang out with her a bunch and see if I can instill some sort of object permanence re: my presence in the home. Before that, let’s read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Stranger Video is a website that wants access to your webcam. Grant it and it will show you a close-up of your own face, the background around you cropped out. Close your eyes to tell it you're ready, and open them again when you hear a chime. It'll now connect you to a stranger doing the same thing: first person to blink loses.

You can play it here.

 
Read more
articles.title: Let's have a staring contest

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Valve have their own rating system for measuring how games run on Steam Deck, but even following the guidance of whether something is "Playable" or "Verified", I've still run into games that simply do not work on the handheld device.

Enter Steam reviews. Reviews from players who primarily played on Steam Deck will now have a little Deck icon, which when moused over tells you the exact amount of time spent on the Deck.

 
Read more
articles.title: You can now filter Steam reviews to show those who "played mostly on Steam Deck"

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Tens of thousands of people have been playing Deadlock, a new multiplayer shooter from Valve, for the past several months, but in that time there's been no official announcement or acknowledgement of the game's existence by its creators. Until now. Valve have posted an extremely barebones Steam store page for Deadlock, describing it as a "multiplayer game in early development."

 
Read more
articles.title: Deadlock, Valve's new multiplayer shooter, now has a barebones Steam page

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google se chystá prosadit další zkrácení platnosti certifikátů až na 90 dnů. Neznáme přesné datum, ale certifikační autority ho znají a intenzivně se na velkou změnu připravují. Jste připraveni i vy?
articles.title: Google chce omezit platnost certifikátů na 90 dnů, změna zřejmě přijde brzy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si zobrazíme informace o systému, vyzkoušíme grafické rozhraní pro správu Gitu, přehrajeme si hudební alba a uděláme si pořádek v oprávněních k souborům.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (11. 9. 2024): zjistěte detaily o svém počítači

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Tauchman)
articles.description: V rámci třetího tématického bloku okolo počítače Commodore 64 se zastavím u dalšího kusu hardware, který se mi dostal do rukou. Opět se budu věnovat datovému úložišti, v tomto případě ale znatelně raritnějšímu.
articles.title: Třetí zastavení u počítače Commodore 64: 3,5" disketovka Commodore 1581

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dnes dokončíme popis možností grafické karty VGA. Ukážeme si, jaké operace lze provádět při čtení a při zápisu do obrazové paměti, a to včetně popisu rychlé operace blokového přenosu (BitBLT), kdy lze přenést celých 32 bitů.
articles.title: Skrytá síla karty VGA: čtecí a zápisové režimy (dokončení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Hledáte vhodný termín pro společnou událost? Nejen v tomto případě by vám mohl přijít vhod článek, který popisuje zkušenost s preferenčním hlasováním účastníků ve sdílené tabulce dokumentu Google Sheets s využitím Schulzeho metody.
articles.title: Preferenční hlasování ve sdílené tabulce Schulzeho metodou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Tato taškařice, vhodná na Apríla, je původně starý text z roku 2001 ze sekce „Zasmáli jsme se“ Linuxových novin, jsem autorem, takže jej ještě copypastuju na blog, abych na něj ex post upozornil.
articles.title: Šokující tajemství unixových systémů: hyperuživatel odhalen

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Kopřiva)
articles.description: Podíváme se na nový útok umožňující klonovat tokeny YubiKey, nové trendy v sextortion útocích, nebo zprávu o útocích ruské APT skupiny, na jejíž přípravě participovaly i české zpravodajské služby.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: klonování hardwarových tokenů YubiKey

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Projekt FreeBSD bude brzy dostane investici od německého fondu Sovereign Tech Fund (STF) ve výši 686 400 eur. Vývojáři KDE vtěsnali několik dalších funkcí do chystaného prostředí Plasma 6.2.
articles.title: FreeBSD dostane peníze od německého STF, nové funkce pro Plasma 6.2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Knihovna Cairo má po roce novou stabilní verzi, Intel Arc konečně s měřením otáček ventilátorů na Linuxu 6.12, Mesa 24.2.2 s podporou Intel Lunar Lake a Battlemage / Xe2, vývojová verze Wine 9.17.
articles.title: Dopad záplat na Zen5 se limitně blíží nule, Wine opravuje podporu čtvrt století starého QuickTime

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Tímto příspěvkem bych chtěl volně navázat na předchozí články zabývající se klasifikací obrázků do několika tříd. V těch dřívějších článcích se jednalo o rozpoznání zápalu plic na základě RTG snímků.
articles.title: Lokalizace infekce malárie: klasifikační model a heatmap

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Soudní dvůr Evropské unie vynesl dva rozsudky. První se týká daňového zvýhodňování společnosti Apple, které jí poskytovalo Irsko (PDF), druhý pak zneužívání dominantního postavení společnosti Google/Alphabet (PDF).
articles.title: Evropský soud: Apple byl zvýhodněn, Irsko má vymoci 13 miliard eur zpět a Google dostal pokutu 2,4 miliardy eur

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Příští verze balíku Mesa už nebude podporovat rozhraní OpenMAX. Nikdy se pořádně nepoužívalo a velice záhy jemu zamýšlenou roli převzaly jiné prvky.
articles.title: Mesa 24.3 už bez podpory rozhraní OpenMAX

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Tradiční trojice iPhonů nové generace byla představena a na trh zamíří už tento pátek. Apple zde sází nadále na vlastní ARM SoC, konkrétně A18 vyráběný 3nm procesem u TSMC.
articles.title: Apple představil iPhone 16 (Plus, Pro, Pro Max)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: V stredu 18. 9. 2024 o 10:00h sa začne nová séria webinárov nielen pre monitoring komunitu. Ukážeme si ďalšie riešenie PostgreSQL klastra pre Zabbixové prostredie. Tento webinár je určený pre tých, ktorí chcú dosiahnuť vysokú dostupnosť a škálovateľnosť Zabbixu pomocou spoľahlivého databázového riešenia.
articles.title: Webinár zdarma: PostgreSQL databázový klaster inak

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Šimerda)
articles.description: Je září a máme tu pátý obnovený pražský meetup vývojářů, kteří se zajímají o programovací jazyk Rust, a vedle toho konečně první moravský meetup. Kdo máte chuť se dozvědět víc a potkat se s aktivními lidmi z rustovské komunity, zastavte se 18. září v Olomouci nebo 26. září v Praze! Zájem o Rust v Česku roste, tak ať vám něco neuteče.
articles.title: Rust meetupy v Olomouci a Praze

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Server Phoronix dnes testoval dva 192jádrové ARM64 systémy. Jedním byl AmpereOne A192–32X (192 jader na 3,2 GHz) a druhým AWS Graviton4 (192 Neoverse V2 na 2,7 GHz).
articles.title: Nejrychlejší ARM64: AmpereOne proti AWS Graviton4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Čip v Raspberry Pi Pico RP2040 má svůj Rust už dlouhou dobu. Existuje například projekt rp-rs a také embassy-rs s asynchronním frameworkem pro embedded zařízení Embassy. Vývojář Jonathan Pallant přidal do projektu rp-rs podporu pro Raspberry Pi Pico 2 s čipem RP2350.
articles.title: Rust na Raspberry Pi Pico 2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Docker je dnes technologie, která proces vývoje, testování a provozování softwaru velmi zjednodušuje. Provozujte cokoliv a kdekoliv. Už nečekejte na nastavení svého serveru nebo na aktualizaci nějaké knihovny. Mějte prostředí jako součást vaší aplikace.
articles.title: Naučte se pracovat s Dockerem a kontejnery (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Vývojář KDE  Nate Graham na svém blogu před dvěma týdny napsal, že KDE bude jednou za rok zobrazovat žádost o finanční příspěvek. Bude to v prosinci a je jedno, jak tuto žádost uživatel zavře. Objeví se zase až za rok.
articles.title: KDE/Plasma bude jednou za rok zobrazovat žádost o finanční příspěvek

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Notebook Slimbook Plasma VI byl představen na konferenci KDE Akademy a už je podrobně popsán na webu kde.slimbook.es. Je vybaven procesorem AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS s integrovanou grafikou Radeon 780M, displejem s rozlišením 2560×1600, hliníkovým šasi a sloty na DDR5–5600 s podporou až 96 GB RAM.
articles.title: KDE Slimbook VI je poháněn procesorem AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Alejandro Colomar, který poslední čtyři roky spravoval linuxové manuálové stránky, oznámil, že bude muset tuto práci ukončit. Tuto užitečnou činnost totiž dělal ve svém volném čase a žádná firma jeho práci nesponzorovala. V současné době již nemohu tuto práci ekonomicky udržet. Dočasně a na dobu neurčitou tedy přestanu na tomto projektu pracovat, vysvětluje ve svém mailu.
articles.title: Údržba linuxových manuálových stránek byla pozastavena

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tým vývojářů okolo webového serveru Nginx oznámil, že oficiální vývoj otevřeného kódu projektu Nginx se přesunul z Mercurialu na GitHub. Projekt tedy bude nyní přijímat příspěvky ve formě pull requestů.
articles.title: Nginx přesunul svůj vývoj na GitHub

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Minulý týden jsme tu měli projekt internetového rádia Yoradio s ESP32. Poté jsem byl upozorněn na projekt AM/FM rádia, také založeném na ESP32 a čipu TEF6686/TEF6687. Projekt založila skupina kolem FMDX.org. Dokáže přijímat FM OIRT a CCIR 65–108 MHz a také AM dlouhé, střední a krátké vlny 144 kHz – 27 MHz.
articles.title: Open source AM/FM rádio s ESP32

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description:
Server Phoronix testoval server s procesorem AmpereOne A192–32X 
(192 Arm64 jader na 3,2 GHz) na jádře 6.11 s výchozí stránkou 4 kB a 64 kB. Jako téměř všechny Arm64 procesory je výchozí stránka konfigurovatelná a může být 4, 16, nebo 64 kB. Přitom x86 má pouze 4 kB. Větší stránka znamená větší výkon, ale také o trochu větší spotřebu paměti. Google u Androidu chystá přechod z 4 kB na 16 kB a slibuje průměrně o 5–10 % lepší výkon a asi o 9 % větší spotřebu paměti.
articles.title: Test výkonu AmpereOne se stránkou 64 kB

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Výzkumníci z Virtuals Protocol vytvořili AI MarioVGG (Virtual Game Generation), která dokáže vytvořit video hru jen podle videa, v tomto případě Super Mario Bros.  Dataset s obrázky ze hry je dostupný na GitHubu. Obsahuje přes 700 tisíc obrázků z 280 úrovní hry. Přitom se rozlišují pouze příkazy „běž doprava“ a „běž doprava a skoč“.
articles.title: AI vytvořilo hru Super Mario jen podle videa

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: O podpoře GPU Intel Lunar Lake a Battlemage Xe2 v linuxovém jádře jsme tu dnes psali. Dostane se do jádra 6.12.
articles.title: Mesa 24.2.2 podporuje Intel Lunar Lake a Battlemage Xe2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: HTTPS se stává běžným, většina webů už ho nasadila. Jak to ale udělat správně, opravdu bezpečně a hlavně bezbolestně? Na školení HTTPS pro správce serverů si ukážeme si nejnovější trendy, prakticky si vyzkoušíme vygenerování certifikátu a nasazení na web server.
articles.title: HTTPS pro správce serverů (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Jason Donenfeld, vývojář WireGuardu, již dva roky pracuje na getrandom() ve vDSO, aby bylo možné náhodná čísla v user-space generovat rychleji přímo v jádře. Pro architekturu x86_64 bylo getrandom() ve vDSO začleněno do jádro 6.11.
articles.title: Jádro 6.12 bude mít getrandom() ve vDSO pro Arm64 a LoongArch

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Intel se podělil o několik důležitých novinek týkajících se vyšetřování problému s nestabilitou Vmin Shift u desktopových procesorů Intel Core 13. a 14. generace, o které jsme psali už v srpnu. Výrobce potvrdil, že nová generace procesorů s kódovým označením Arrow Lake a Lunar Lake problémem netrpí.
articles.title: Intel vydal nový seznam procesorů, které nejsou ovlivněny nestabilitou „Vmin Shift“

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojářům operačního systému Redox OS napsaném v jazyce Rust se podařilo vyřešit výkonnostní úzké hrdlo, takže je systém mnohem výkonnější, když běží jako virtuální stroj. V některých syntetických benchmarcích dokonce dokáže běžet „o něco rychleji“ než Linux. Žádná konkrétní čísla ale zveřejněna nebyla.
articles.title: Redox zlepšil výkon ve virtuálním prostředí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři uvolnili novou verzi virtualizačního nástroje QEMU označenou jako 9.1. Přináší řadu změn v mnoha oblastech, nejdůležitější je ale podpora nových procesorů Intel Icelake-Server-v7, SapphireRapids-v3 a SierraForest a podporu AMD SEV-SNP použitelnou s novými jádry s podporou pro AMD EPYC.
articles.title: Vyšlo QEMU 9.1 s podporou AMD SEV-SNP a akcelerací Intel IAA při migraci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Mozilla má zájem o dekodér obrázků JPEG XL napsaný v jazyce Rust kvůli jeho paměťové bezpečnosti. Bobby Holley, technický šéf Firefoxu, vyjádřil svůj postoj k podpoře dekodéru obrázků JPEG XL pro Firefox napsaného v Rustu. Říká v něm, že vývojáři zvažují zařazení nového dekodéru napsaného v Rustu.
articles.title: Mozilla by chtěla dekodér pro JPEG XL napsaný v Rustu, vyvine jej zřejmě Google

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V repozitářích pro aktuální Debian je sice k dispozici více než 74 tisíc balíčků pro architekturu x86_64, ale ne všechny balíčky jsou dobře udržované a část z nich již dlouho nebyla udržována či aktualizována. Vývojáři Debianu nedávno začali diskutovat o tom, jak začít z archivu odstraňovat další z těchto dlouho neudržovaných balíčků.
articles.title: Vývojáři Debianu diskutují o odstranění neudržovaných balíčků

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google oznámil, že zdrojový kód systému Android 15 byl uvolněn do projektu Android Open-Source Project (AOSP). Pro telefony Pixel by přitom systém byl měl být vydán během několika následujících týdnů. Ostatní výrobci na svá zařízení dostanou Android 15 v řádu měsíců. Nyní mohou na portaci začít také tvůrci alternativních ROM.
articles.title: Android 15 uvolněn do projektu Android Open-Source

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Pytelka)
articles.description: Tým věnující se projektu Bugzilla připravil po pěti letech novou stabilní verzi 5.2. Současně pokračuje vývoj budoucí verze 6 (projekt Harmony), společně byla vydána verze 5.9.1 - Developer Preview Release.
articles.title: Vyšla Bugzilla 5.2 a 5.91

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled srpnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za srpen 2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Patří datová centra do vesmíru? Acer představuje nové notebooky Swift Copilot+ s procesory Intel Core Ultra (Series 2). Kam míří automatizace sítí. Školy a univerzity stále více doplácejí na zanedbávání zranitelností. Kvantové počítače spolupracují s magnony.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Kvantové počítače spolupracují s magnony

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 36/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Black Hole Moon: Máme tu další nápad, jak by mimozemské civilizace mohly čerpat energii z černých děr. Odchylky v interakcích částic mají ukazovat na existenci nových bosonů. Předpovídají nový detekovatelný zdroj gravitačních vln z kolabujících hvězd.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Informatici z Matfyzu získali US patent na vícezdrojový překlad

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ness Czech spouští nový inovační datový hub pro střední a východní Evropu. Fortinet rozšiřuje bezpečnostní platformu pro ochranu kyberneticko-fyzikálních systémů. Umělá inteligence předvídá zločin a odhalí i ukrytou zbraň. Budoucnost podnikové umělé inteligence není o větším množství dat. Red Hat na podporu svých implementačních partnerů rozšířil partnerský program.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Budoucnost podnikové umělé inteligence není o větším množství dat

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nový objev ve světě polovodičů: Vědci potvrdili existenci další modifikace uhlíku. Black Hole Moon: Máme tu další nápad, jak by mimozemské civilizace mohly čerpat energii z černých děr. Vodu v hlubinách Marsu nepřeceňovat.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Technosignatury se možná dají snadno přehlédnout

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Slevy v akci Back to School pokračují. Jedna ze stránek, která poskytuje nejlepší nabídku a je také spolehlivá, je Goodoffer24.com. Zde jsou ceny které se vymykají, zvláště pro operační systém Microsoft, a to jak pro současnou verzi, tak předchozí, a také jak pro verze Pro či Home. A dále také, s exkluzivním kódem, můžete získat další 30% slevu, abyste se mohli těšit z doživotních licencí. Nebo jinak, platíte jen jednou a můžete zapomenout na problémy.
articles.title: Slevy na Goodoffer24 Back to School až 91 %: Windows 11 jen za €20, Office za €24!

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 35/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Acronis představuje novou verzi Acronis True Image na českém trhu. Prodej podnikového softwaru vzrostl v roce 2023 o 12 %. Vědci vyvinuli metodu detekce jednoatomových defektů v polovodičích. Každá pátá firma zasažena útoky na dodavatelský řetězec hardwaru. České firmy platí po útoků ransomwarem výkupné i 6 milionů Kč.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Prodej podnikového softwaru vzrostl v roce 2023 o 12 %

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Navrhují hledat temnou hmotu v neutronových hvězdách. Nová analýza dat z Webbova dalekohledu ukazuje, že s Hubbleovou konstantou nemusí být problém.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Nitridy uhlíku mohou konkurovat diamantu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 34/2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová major verze 1.0 oficiálního firmwaru pro zařízení Flipper Zero (Wikipedie). Po třech letech vývoje. Přehled novinek i s náhledy a videi v příspěvku na blogu: podpora aplikací třetích stran, nový NFC podsystém, podpora JavaScriptu pro psaní aplikací, vylepšení spotřeby, zrychlení Bluetooth přenosu…
articles.title: Verze 1.0 oficiálního firmwaru pro Flipper Zero

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Unicode Consortium, nezisková organizace koordinující rozvoj standardu Unicode, oznámila vydání Unicode 16.0. Přidáno bylo 5 185 nových znaků. Celkově jich je 154 998. Přibylo 7 nových Emoji.
articles.title: Unicode 16.0

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Radicle, distribuovaná alternativa k softwaru pro spolupráci jako např. GitLab, byl vydán ve verzi 1.0. Nyní obsahuje nad gitem postavený, rozšiřitelný protokol pro diskuze a nakládání s patchi, autentizaci a autorizaci, integraci Toru a uživatelské rozhraní v příkazovém řádku či jednoduché webové rozhraní pro prohlížení repozitářů. Projekt byl dříve představen a diskutován na Linux Weekly News.
articles.title: Radicle 1.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 6.7 živé linuxové distribuce Tails (The Amnesic Incognito Live System), jež klade důraz na ochranu soukromí uživatelů a anonymitu. Přehled změn v příslušném seznamu. Tor Browser byl povýšen na verzi 13.5.3. Thunderbird na verzi 115.15.0. OnionShare z verze 2.2 na verzi 2.6.
articles.title: Tails 6.7

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Rozsudky Soudního dvora Evropské unie ve věcech C-465/20 P (Apple) a C-48/22 P (Google a Alphabet): Irsko poskytlo společnosti Apple protiprávní daňová zvýhodnění ve výši 13 miliard eur a je povinné je získat zpět. Byla potvrzena pokuta ve výši 2,4 miliardy eur uložená společnosti Google za to, že zneužívala svého dominantního postavení tím, že upřednostňovala vlastní službu srovnávání výrobků.
articles.title: Rozsudky Soudního dvora Evropské unie ve věcech C-465/20 P (Apple) a C-48/22 P (Google a Alphabet)

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Apache Cassandra (Wikipedie), tj. open source NoSQL distribuovaná databáze, byla vydána v nové major verzi 5.0. Přehled novinek v příspěvku na blogu a v souboru NEWS na GitHubu.
articles.title: Apache Cassandra 5.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost MNT Research oznámila, že po open source noteboocích MNT Reform a MNT Pocket Reform bude následovat MNT Reform Next. Časem se objeví na Crowd Supply. Vývoj lze sledovat na Mastodonu.
articles.title: Open source notebook MNT Reform Next

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Apple představil (YouTube) telefony iPhone 16 Pro a iPhone 16, hodinky Watch Series 10 a Watch Ultra 2 a sluchátka AirPods 4, AirPods Pro 2 a AirPods Max.
articles.title: iPhone 16 Pro, iPhone 16, Watch Series 10, Watch Ultra 2, AirPods 4, AirPods Pro 2 a AirPods Max

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána verze 0.9.0 operačního systému Redox OS (Wikipedie). Jedná se o mikrokernelový unixový operační systém naprogramovaný v programovacím jazyce Rust. Zdrojové kódy jsou k dispozici na GitLabu pod licencí MIT. Z novinek lze vypíchnout aplikace Files, Editor a Terminal z desktopového prostředí COSMIC, RustPython nebo webový server Simple HTTP Server.
articles.title: Redox OS 0.9.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Dnes ve 23:59 končí hlasování o přednáškách na konferenci LinuxDays 2024, která proběhne o víkendu 12. a 13. října v Praze.
articles.title: Dnes končí hlasování o přednáškách na LinuxDays 2024

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: WolfSSL is an embedded SSl/TLS library designed for a range of use-cases and available as open-source under the GNU GPLv2. WolfSSL was recently packaged and added to Fedora Linux since Netatalk began building against wolfSSL and in the longer-term plans to require its use. So the Fedora packager of Netatalk went ahead with packaging up wolfSSL. But this in turn has led to issues and as of today is now being "immediately retired from Fedora."..
articles.title: wolfSSL "Immediately Retired" From Fedora Linux For Failing To Follow Packaging Rules

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As part of the ongoing AmpereOne testing at Phoronix with the 192-core AmpereOne A192-32X flagship processor, I've been working on several different Linux distribution benchmarks with this Supermicro AmpereOne server. That comparison in full should be published next week while worth highlighting on its own are some of the gains seen with the in-development CentOS Stream 10 that serves as the upstream to what will be Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10. There are some nice performance gains seen on AArch64 with CentOS Stream 10 compared to CentOS Stream 9.
articles.title: CentOS Stream 10 Showing Nice Performance Uplift In Early Benchmarks On AmpereOne

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel today as part of their "Patch Tuesday" released new CPU microcode for recent generation Core and Xeon processors. Two security updates were made along with fixing a handful of functional issues...
articles.title: Intel CPU Microcode 20240910 Fixes Two Security Issues, Various Functional Issues

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A patch merged yesterday to the GNU C Library (glibc) codebase can help the memset() function's performance by 24% as measured on an Arm Neoverse-N1 core...
articles.title: GNU C Library Tuning For AArch64 Helps Memset Performance By ~24%

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the upcoming Linux 6.12 kernel the Intel graphics driver will finally be able to report GPU fan speeds. Another long sought feature is also on the way for this open-source Linux driver: GPU package temperature reporting for Intel discrete GPUs...
articles.title: Intel Linux Graphics Driver To Finally Expose GPU Package Temperature

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: AlmaLinux to further distinguish itself from other RHEL-based Linux distributions has announced a Certification Special Interest Group (SIG) and out of that is coming a AlmaLinux Hardware Certification Program...
articles.title: AlmaLinux Announces Certification SIG, Hardware Certification Program

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While OpenJDK Java is available via the Ubuntu package archive and the go-to JVM on Ubuntu Linux, Canonical is working to package up Oracle's GraalVM as another option for enhancing the Java stack on Ubuntu...
articles.title: Canonical Working To Package GraalVM For Ubuntu Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel today released a new version of QATlib, the QuickAssist Technology library for enjoying hardware-accelerated offloading of security, authentication, and compression needs. Recent Intel Xeon CPUs with built-in QAT accelerators stand to benefit a lot from the new QATlib 24.09 release...
articles.title: Intel QATlib 24.09 Improves Performance For Multi-Threaded Apps & Multi-Socket Servers

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel engineers have been working on enabling NPEM for Linux: Native PCIe Enclosure Management as a means of standardized storage LED indicators...
articles.title: Intel Preps Native PCIe Enclosure Management "NPEM" For Standardized Storage LEDs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following Canonical's decision to enable frame pointers by default in Ubuntu 24.04 LTS and then they ended up adding a number of performance tools to ship by default with Ubuntu 24.04 LTS, for Ubuntu 24.10 a late change is adding another tool to be installed by default on the Ubuntu desktop: Sysprof...
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.10 Desktop To Ship With Sysprof Profiler Pre-Installed

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Thanks to the work of Valve Linux graphics driver developer Samuel Pitoiset, the Radeon "RADV" Vulkan driver is now the first within Mesa supporting the new Vulkan pipeline binary extension...
articles.title: RADV Merges Vulkan Pipeline Binary Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Intel Arrow Lake Linux graphics driver support appears largely wrapped up following a patch for properly handling the necessary GSC firmware requirements and building off all the existing Meteor Lake Arc Graphics driver code paths. There are a number of Arrow Lake PCI device IDs already present for the graphics while a new one is being added now to the kernel drivers...
articles.title: Another Arrow Lake Graphics Device ID Being Added To Intel's Linux Driver

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last year Canonical delivered an Intel TDX "tech preview" for Ubuntu 23.10 to experiment with using Intel Trust Domain Extensions (TDX) found on the latest Xeon server processors. With Ubuntu 24.04 LTS they began shipping a formal TDX software stack and now have rolled out an update to that software stack as a stable release update...
articles.title: Canonical Shipping Updated Intel TDX Software For Ubuntu 24.04 LTS

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Some long-rotting code in Mesa has been flushed out today... Mesa 24.3 is now 11.6k lines of code lighter after removing support for the OpenMAX (OMX) API that was implemented as a Gallium3D state tracker long ago and hasn't seen any activity in recent years and the upstream OpenMAX standards work halted more than one decade ago...
articles.title: Mesa 24.3 Removes Support For The Long-Abandoned OpenMAX API

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last month I wrote about Intel Linux engineers working on a new Efficiency Latency Control feature for their uncore driver. This ELC option allows for adjusting the behavior of the Intel uncore for efficiency versus latency characteristics. Those Intel ELC patches to the TPMI uncore driver are now queued up for merging with the upcoming Linux 6.12 cycle...
articles.title: Intel Efficiency Latency Control "ELC" Feature Slated For Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Excitement is building that the real-time kernel "PREEMPT_RT" support might finally be ready for the mainline kernel as soon as the upcoming Linux 6.12 merge window. It will be interesting to see if that long-awaited day finally comes this month but recently noted patches have now been queued into tip/tip.git's "sched/rt" branch ahead of the Linux 6.12 merge window...
articles.title: Latest "sched/rt" Commits Point To PREEMPT_RT Potentially Being Ready For Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the Supermicro ARS-211M-NR R13SPD server that's in the lab for a few weeks for reviewing the AmpereOne A192-32X and delivering the first independent benchmarks of the AmpereOne 192-core AArch64 server processor, the AmpereOne benchmarks to date have been comparing to other Intel Xeon and AMD EPYC server platforms. But if looking up to the cloud is the closest AArch64 server competition to AmpereOne there is: Amazon's Graviton4. In today's article ia showdown looking at how AmpereOne and AWS Graviton4 compete at 192 cores for ARM 64-bit server performance.
articles.title: AWS Graviton4 vs. AmpereOne 192-Core Benchmarks For Leading AArch64 Server Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Redox OS 0.9 has been released today as a big update to this from-scratch Rust-written open-source operating system...
articles.title: Redox OS 0.9 Brings COSMIC Apps, Better Performance & Improved Linux App Compatibility

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Earlier this summer KDE began soliciting ideas for what their goals should be over the next 2~3 years. This weekend at their annual Akademy KDE developer conference their next round of goals were solidified...
articles.title: KDE Plans To Enhance Application Development Experience, Recruit More Contributors

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While Intel Lunar Lake is only beginning to ship later this month, Intel Linux engineers have already begun work on enabling its successor: Panther Lake. With the upcoming Linux 6.12 kernel cycle will be more early enablement work on Intel Panther Lake, presumably what will be the Core Ultra 300 series...
articles.title: Intel Panther Lake HDMI Audio Support Coming With Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Miracle-WM 0.3.5 was released this weekend as the newest step forward for this Mir-based window manager / Wayland compositor developed by a Canonical engineer. Miracle-WM continues being polished ahead of the upcoming Fedora Miracle Spin debuting as part of Fedora 41...
articles.title: Mir-based Miracle-WM Adds Optional Systemd Integration

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: OpenJPH v0.16 has been released as the newest version of this open-source implementation of High-Throughput JPEG2000 (HTJK), also known as JPH / JPEG2000 Part 15. With this new release comes faster performance thanks to making use of Advanced Vector Extensions 2 (AVX2) to complement its existing AVX-512 code...
articles.title: OpenJPH v0.16 Now Using AVX2 For Faster HTJ2K/JPEG2000

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Hyprland 0.43 is out as the newest version of this independent, very customizable Wayland compositor focused on providing a dynamic tiling experience...
articles.title: Hyprland 0.43 Wayland Compositor Releases, Raises Build Requirements To C++26

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The GNOME 47 release candidate was announced a short time ago in preparing for the stable GNOME 47 stable desktop coming up...
articles.title: GNOME 47 Release Candidate Brings Last Minute Changes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following recent international travels, Linus Torvalds is back to his usual late Sunday Linux kernel release regiment. Linux 6.11-rc7 was released a few minutes ago as Linux 6.11 approaches the finish line...
articles.title: Linux 6.11-rc7 Released: Linux 6.11 Stable Possibly Next Sunday

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While Windows gamers seem mixed over the AMD Ryzen 9000 series processors, for creator, scientific / HPC, code development, and many other technical computing areas I remain very impressed by the Ryzen 9000 (Zen 5) series desktop processors more than one month into constant testing with these Granite Ridge chips. One of the areas I hadn't explored until now but made me curious given the mixed messaging around gaming was how well workstation graphics workloads were performing with the new processors. For this brief weekend article is a look at the workstation graphics performance between the Ryzen 9 9950X and former Ryzen 9 7950X/7950X3D processors.
articles.title: AMD Ryzen 9 9950X vs. Ryzen 9 7950X/7950X3D For Workstation Graphics

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The work written about earlier this year on New Intel Linux Patches Continue Working To Improve Hybrid CPU Task Placement looks like it will be merged for the upcoming Linux 6.12 cycle as the patches have now been queued into the power management subsystem's "-next" branch. This latest Intel Core hybrid handling work is particularly focused on hybrid P/E-core processors without SMT / Hyper Threading, such as found with the upcoming Core Ultra 200V "Lunar Lake" processors...
articles.title: Linux 6.12 To Enhance The Hybrid P/E Core Experience On Intel Lunar Lake

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: OpenBMC as the Linux Foundation project backed by vendors like Intel / Microsoft / Google / Meta for an open-source BMC firmware stack continues to be a growing success. This alternative to long-used proprietary BMC software stacks continues to grow in popularity with AMD now using it on their reference motherboards and Supermicro being another notable user with some of their server platforms. Not entirely new but been meaning to write about it and NVIDIA talked more openly about it this week: NVIDIA is also a big supporter and user of OpenBMC for their high-end AI/HPC servers and BlueField DPU hardware...
articles.title: Even NVIDIA Has Jumped Big On The Open-Source OpenBMC Train

articles.description: Merged three years ago in Linux 5.12 was IDMAPPED mounts for new use-cases from containers to systemd-homed. IDMAPPED mounts allow for different mounts to expose the same file or directory with different ownership such as for sharing files between multiple users or multiple systems. With time all of the major Linux file-systems have seen support added for IDMAPPED mounts while for Linux 6.12 support is on the way for FUSE file-systems...
articles.title: FUSE Adding IDMAPPED Mounts Support In Linux 6.12

In Anime Vanguards, Igris, also known as Igros or his evolved form, Igris the Elite Knight, is one of the strongest units in the entire game. Alongside the announcement of Destiny 2's new content structure, players got an extra sprinkle of good news that confirmed a fan-favorite sniper rifle from the original Destiny would soon make the transition to Destiny 2. 


Bungie has confirmed the Ice Breaker is coming as a part of a new Dungeon that's also on the way. However, while details are scarce on the Dungeon itself, Bungie had to comment on Ice Breaker, considering it accidentally became a part of the franchise's 10th Anniversary key art.


The Ice Breaker was an Exotic sniper rifle from the original Destiny. The weapon was unique in that it would slowly regenerate ammo but could never have more than one clip at a time. Ammo pickups also did nothing for the weapon, but kills had a chance to refund ammo and cause enemies to explo…

Bot of War is the last level you need to finish in the second galaxy of Astro Bot, called the Tentacle System. After the boss is gone, travel to the new location for a chilly reception. 


The first raven is a gimme. But before you can start hunting down the rest, you'll need to meet the bot facsimiles of Kratos and Atreus. Once you get your hands on the Leviathan Axe and gain its power, it's time to take it for a spin.

I never imagined Sonic the Hedgehog would become the star of a cinematic universe, but here we are. Sonic the Hedgehog 3 is whipping out the big guns, pitting Sonic against his greatest rival in a big-budget adaptation of the storyline that forever changed the Blue Blur's video game series.

As the film's surprisingly epic trailer explains via voiceover, Shadow was born out of Project Shadow, a sinister government operation with shocking ties to Sonic's (Ben Schwartz) archenemy, Dr. Robotnik (Jim Carrey).

The little robot on a mission to save his coworkers in Astro Bot is filled with all sorts of trophies for players to earn. Whether they're the standard trophies you can find in the menu or hidden trophies for those looking for a challenge, there's plenty to achieve.


One of the trophies available is the Thick as Thieves trophy, which can be tricky if you don't know what you're looking for. We're here to help you get the Thick as Thieves trophy in Astro Bot to add to your collection.


How to unlock the Thick as Thieves Trophy


In order to unlock the trophy, you'll need to get a shot of Nathan Drake and Lara Croft in the same photo. These are the two legendary explorers mentioned in the trophy description. To get the photo, head to the Crash Site once you have both bots rescued. You'll al…

The Warhammer 40,000 universe is dominated by war and strife, but it's not all calculated Ultramarine battle lines and space dogfights. There is another much more primal force at work, tearing through systems and consuming worlds to sate a never-ending hunger: Tyranids. 


The Tyranids may be the main enemy featured throughout Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2, but the game only scratches the surface of the lore. The Tyranids are not an organized faction; it's a hive mind. That is to say, every individual form and creature that's classified as a Tyranid acts in unison as one organism.


Like the titular creature from the film Alien, Tyranids are the ultimate killing machine. The insectoid-like organisms have evolved into multiple forms and subspecies, and Tyranids still use rapid evolution …
articles.title: Warhammer 40K: What are the Tyranids?

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
Considering that Astro Bot harnesses more than 100 cameo bots, keeping track of them will often prove difficult. There's even more to deal with once you unlock the Gatcha Lab, bringing exclusive showcases for the characters. So, if you don't want to get lost at the Crash Site, here's how to look at your collection in Astro Bot.


How to keep track of your Astro Bot collection


Rather than exploring around to find every Astro Bot, use the A5081 memory card at the Crash Site to look at your entire collection. The feature unlocks after you complete the Gorilla Nebula's Sky Garden. Once you've done this, locate the card near the PlayStation 5 ship at the center, near the group of bots.


Hit the A5081 card to transfer to the collection page. Currently, there are 169 slots to fill up, featuring the Astro Bot character and their Gatcha Lab showcase. Select them to get a better view of their animation, and use the zoom feature to discover hidden details. Any bots that haven't been found yet display PlayStation control icons, which will be inaccessible until they are acquired.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Filling out the entire Astro Bot collection requires much time and patience. Plus, some characters only unlock after you've achieved the game's hidden trophies, ending with a grueling challenge mode.


Although it's handy to use the memory card's collection hub, I still recommend interacting with the special cameo bots in the Crash Site. You'll uncover plenty of fun-filled animations the collection doesn't show; some even have a trophy tied to them. All you need to do is hit the Astro Bot and see how they react to your sudden punches. It's a fun and surprising experience, as each bot's reaction is unique and pays homage to their respective franchises.

The post How to look at your collection in Astro Bot appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to look at your collection in Astro Bot

What counts as Seafood in Disney Dreamlight Valley?

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
Roblox's World of Stands has undergone many changes since its inception in 2021. We've seen updates like Chapter 1's Part 3 storyline, which introduces new Stands for your arsenal. So, whether you want to stay informed or connect with the community, we'll show you the links for World of Stands' Trello and Discord links.


World of Stands Trello and Discord links


You can find the World of Stands Trello through this link. Discover multiple Stands in the board's dedicated section, including the new Anubis Chariot and beginner Death 13. There's also a plethora of information on countless items, from the Shiny Arrow to the Secret Invitation.


If you're new to the World of Stands, the Trello board is your best friend. It's a comprehensive guide to key terms and locations. Once you're ready, dive into the Achievement Titles hub and start tackling the formidable challenges. It won't be for the faint of heart, as it features some of the most difficult objectives in the game.


To get more invested in the World of Stands community, join the game's official Discord. It's the perfect place for announcements, typically providing the latest updates. While most focus on significant improvements, there's another section on minor bug fixes if you're experiencing any problems.


Image via SpicyWater


Content creators will also find a video hub to commemorate their World of Stands creations. And, even if you don't dabble in videos, you can at least use the player-made content to uncover handy tips and tricks for your next playthrough.


Other World of Stands social links 


Besides World of Stands Trello and Discord, you can follow the game's TikTok and Twitter pages. Both platforms keep you up-to-date on everything, including patch release dates and character showcases. Plus, you can acquire some World of Stands codes to get special rewards for your adventures. 

The post World of Stands Trello and Discord links to connect with the community appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: World of Stands Trello and Discord links to connect with the community

articles.author: Ty Valentine
articles.description:
Musician Martyn Ware has taken to Twitter recently to air his frustration with Rockstar Games. The source of the Heaven 17 member's dismay is an offer he allegedly received from the acclaimed studio to put his song in Grand Theft Auto 6, which he refused.


Ware claims Rockstar contacted his publisher about the band's song "Temptation" possibly being used in the studio's upcoming title Grand Theft Auto 6. The offer was $7,500 for each of the three writers of the song, which would serve as a buyout of the band's claim to royalties.


Ware learned the details of Rockstar's offer in an email sent to him from his publisher. The musician wasn't impressed with the amount offered by Rockstar, and he was upset that accepting the money would lock him out of receiving any royalties due to the game's success. Martyn's publisher attempted to make a counter-offer of $75,000 up front or $7,500 with a royalty fee. However, the studio allegedly refused to negotiate.


Via @martynware


Some Twitter users are claiming that the amount offered was a standard rate, going so far as to call Ware greedy. Others claimed the exposure and uptick in digital streams of "Temptation" would make up for the lack of royalties. Martyn responded to these claims by pointing out Grand Theft Auto V grossed $8,600,000,000 and that every one million streams of the song would net each writer around $1,000 each, concluding with a "go fuck yourself."


Rockstar has yet to make an official statement on the matter.

The post Rock star blasts Rockstar Games over ‘extremely low’ offer to put song in GTA 6 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Rock star blasts Rockstar Games over ‘extremely low’ offer to put song in GTA 6

Since the release of Counter-Strike 2 in September 2023, many fans have been hard at work on community-made maps for use on custom servers. These maps aren't part of the CS2 Active Duty map pool but can offer a fun change of pace from the usual rotation.
